pages.text:
April 2025
County of Marin EMS R 6
PNEUMOTHORAX/TENSION
PNEUMOTHORAX
Indications
Acute onset of respiratory distress with decreased unilateral or bilateral breath sounds. Signs
and symptoms may include the following:
• Extreme dyspnea • Cyanosis
• Neck vein distention • Hyperresonance to percussion on affected side
• Agitation • Tracheal shift away from the affected side
• Hypotension
ALS RMC
Needle thoracostomy on affected side
with signs of tension pneumothorax
Go to policy:
Pleural Decompression
- ALS PR 8
Rapid transport
SPECIAL CONSIDERATIONS
Condition may be precipitated by the following:
Trauma
Pre-existing lung disease
Cancer related treatment
Marfan’s syndrome
